along the wide expanse of the Fraser River and Vancouver Inlet to that great city itself .

along the cobbles , scattering a flurry of chickens that had been pecking at a fallen crust of bread .

along with loose shoes .

along .

along the gutters to splash with relentless monotony into the tub outside the back door .

The little boy pattered
along beside me , looking up and smiling .

along in the muddy ruts left by the cattle , avoiding other more unpleasant tokens of their passage .

along the northern slopes of the Pentland Hills .

along the skirting board before vanishing through a door .

along the road at first , but soon you pick up speed and rush smoothly forward , and your heart leaps with joy at the mastery of the thing .

along , being eaten by car rubber .

along the narrow , grass-verged roads of ` The Oval " council estate and glided through the town centre and five miles beyond , before reaching Ringinglow Road -- long , isolated and Roman straight -- and putting the car through its paces .
